Message.Title: dividend from e*trade
Message.Msg: Here’s a little nugget.... per E*Trade’s balance sheet.... for 12/31/12... Available-for-sale, trading & held to maturity securities of about $29 bill... per the last 10k... the holdings consist mainly of gov’t agency debt... given lower-of-cost gaap accounting... and the collapse in interest rates... the market value is probably much higher depending on maturity length... here’s the nugget... the avg effective yield on these holdings is about 2.85%... then $10.1 bill in loans receivable - yielding about 4.7%... Margin receivables of $5.8 bill - yielding around 4%... vs. “Sweep deposits” - which is the #1 class of deposits - yielding less than one-tenth of 1%... bottom line... some things are goin right... i believe E*trade will become very profitable in the following quarters... & yes... will start paying a dividend like they discussed on the last confer call in 1Q14.

Offer them same-sex marriage licenses. They will line up for that. Then the government can monitor their whereabouts, purchases, medications, phone calls, emails, internet activity, travel. Remember, if it saves just ONE LIFE, it is worth it.

Topic.Title: ETFC: Rates up = NIM going up. Retail is back = DARTS going up. Real Estate going up = Loan Portfolio going up.

Message.Msg: First, you do have to account for a tax rate with your eps even though you may not actually pay that to the IRS in cash (tax loss carryforwards). That means the 40% rate does apply and for Etrade to have 300mil in earnings annually, they would need to do around 500mil in net earnings before taxes. That would come out to $1 per share and a 15 multiple would give you a $15 share price. That seems like quite a ways off to me, considering they just came off an annual loss of 113mil for 2012. Seems to me like they need to walk before they run here. $50 is really simply absurd.
I think the dividend was between the two E*Trade entities not to the actual shareholders. Not sure though.

Message.Title: Buyout?
Message.Msg: Does anyone think a buyout is coming?

Sometimes I think fresh meat doesn't understanding the "long" part about long term investing. I've got shares up to over 3 years old, maybe 4, but I'm not itching to sell them off at the first hint of a buyout. Aren't you interested in what terms might be acceptable? IF there is a buyout isn't as important as the details. As things stand now I really don't think a buyout would be in the long term interest of the company unless they're completely bearish on the economy.
You wouldn't be suggesting using this devise on a differant male apendature would you?

Message.Title: ETFC acts like a company that might soon get a takeover bid
Message.Msg: ETFC reports poor EPS and the stock sells off, but ends the day up on huge volume. Trend over the last month up and everyone knows they are a very strong takeover candidate . Both Schwab and AMTD have interest. Huge cost cut savings with any deal. The only thing keeping them independent is that loan portfolio which buyers were concerned about. NOW it's three years later and housing is on the rise and concerns are fading! Worth $15-18 on a deal and volume suggests it might happen soon. Disclosure I'm long!!!!!

Topic.Title: ETFC acts like a company that might soon get a takeover bid

Topic.Title: ETFC acts like a company that might soon get a takeover bid

Message.Msg: The most value will not be to AMTD or Schwab, E*Trade is a perfect piece to a larger financial services organization.
